reviewText: This movie is such a "blast from the past" for me. It is such a great story, and so simple and pure of a message in it. My children have just recently watched it with me and cannot get enough of Puff. Would recommend for all ages, and it even begins some arts and craft ideas for children. my child wanted to make herself out of paper.

reviewText: The three Puff the Magic Dragon films in this set were all written by the great Romeo Muller, who also wrote the classic Rankin-Bass holiday films "Rudolph, the Red-Nosed Reindeer," "Frosty the Snowman," "Santa Claus Is Comin' to Town," "The Little Drummer Boy," "Here Comes Peter Cottontail," "The Leprechaun's Christmas Gold," and many other likewise luminous, numinous, glorious films.  Like these, all three Puff films are splendid, funny, uplifting, meaningful, and wonderful.  Music by Peter Yarrow of Peter, Paul, and Mary, and of the many delightful songs here the most thrilling and inspiring are "Weave Me the Sunshine" and "Follow Your Own Star."  You can't go wrong with any film by Romeo Muller, and any and all of them will leave you feeling light and carefree and good at heart.  Romeo was some kind of artistic saint, showering all of us with story-blessings, but never in a preachy way, instead always via an artistry utterly compelling, mesmerizing, and profoundly loving.More info on Romeo at the Rankin-Bass website maintained by the incomparable Rick Goldschmidt--when you get there, click first on "Enter," then scroll down to click on the "Spotlight" section, and then finally click on "Romeo Muller" for a fine biography by Rick and my own filmography.

reviewText: This was one in a trilogy of short films the other to films being Land of Lies and Mr.Nobody. If you love this  short 1970 film based on the popular children songs with Burges Merdith as the gentle dragon puff you will love this. Aword of warning fans of movies such as dragon heart and dragon heart new beginning will probably turn away from this film.  But if any of you saw the movies Peets Dragon done back in mid 1960s or mid 1970s or the movie Rally way dragon or it's sequel which name I don't know you will love this movie.Puff takes young Jacky Drapper he takes out his soul turns him into Jacky Paper together they make and epic trip to Hono Lee to teach Jacky how to be brave and face his fear. Can jack learn how to talk with out puff around and can they save the land of Hollins from the sick and fun Sneeze and restore it to its original glory. Find out in this thrilling musical filled children  adventure for children of all ages. If you like this I also recommend Rail way dragon VHS, Stellaluna,  Curious george, Yanke doudle cricket,  and Rick Tiki Tavi in DVD format.
Title: N/A
